popUp.description: A set of practices that combines software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops) to shorten the systems development life cycle.

popUp.title: Docker

popUp.title: Git and Github
popUp.description: Git is a version control system for tracking changes in source code, while GitHub is a cloud-based platform for hosting and collaborating on Git repositories.
popUp.skills: Version control, Branching and merging, Pull requests, Collaboration, CI/CD integration.

projects.title: Pet Expo
projects.description: Pet Expo is a full-stack application designed to showcase a wide variety of dogs, cats, and birds. It provides detailed information, classifying them by species, origin, current location, and much more. Regular users can browse, search, and filter through a large gallery of animals, while admins have the ability to easily add new species or breeds via a user-friendly interface. The frontend is built with React and utilizes the Framer Motion library to create stunning animations, along with React Router for seamless navigation. The backend is powered by NestJS, and MongoDB is used as the database.

img.name: PetExpo1.jpg
img.description: A gallery snippet showcasing three dog profiles, complete with search and filter functionality.

img.name: PetExpo2.jpg
img.description: A dog details pop-up displaying further information and a link to view the full dog profile.

img.name: PetExpo3.jpg
img.description: A personalized page for each dog, offering more detailed and specific information

img.name: PetExpo4.jpg
img.description: Admin dashboard showing the current animal selection, a search input, and a list of animals in the selected category. Admins can edit or delete dog profiles, and an 'Add Dogs' button opens a form similar to the one for editing.

projects.title: The North Pole
projects.description: The North Pole is yet another fullstack application, this time used as a booking platform, in which the user can pick between booking a car, hotel room or a flight.All three categories include admin created bookings which display all the details neccessary to make the right decision.While users can reserve these bookings for as long and whenever they decide ( as long as the item has not already been booked ) admin have the opportunity to create new bookings and edit and delete existing ones. All users also have access to their own profile page with preferences and more. This application also includes a register and login page combined with email verification.The application itself is built with the asp.net core framework, and simple HTML CSS AND JS. It uses SQLServer as a database.

img.name: NorthPole1.jpg
img.description: Search Browsing functionality within the app. In this specific scenario it shows a list of cars that are availible for booking with detail about each of them.

img.name: NorthPole2.jpg
img.description: Result of a car search. In this specific scenario only one match is found. The user has the option to check further details,bookings for the car, check reviews by other users, and create their own booking!

img.name: NorthPole3.jpg
img.description: The page in which the user books the car.

img.name: NorthPole4.jpg
img.description: The profile page in which the user can edit details about themselves and also post a profile picture. This picture is only visible to other users if a review is left.Only accessable by users that have created an account.

img.name: NorthPole5.jpg
img.description: Admin View of all cars.In addition to the other options, they can also delete postings that they want aswell as create new ones.
